intro: Derris gamblei, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes. Its roots contain rotenone, a natural insecticide used in traditional and modern pest control. Derris gamblei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits in soil enrichment.
